segments.advisor_message: So, moving on to your employment status, could you clarify whether you're currently employed or self-employed? That will help us determine your tax situation better.
segments.client_message: Uh, I'm self-employed, but, um, I'm not sure what exactly you mean by, like, tax situation? What do you mean by that, exactly?

segments.advisor_message: When I say tax situation, I mean where you're domiciled for tax purposes. Basically, this means what country you're living in and if you're considered a tax resident there.
segments.client_message: Oh, right! So I'm in the UK and I've been living here for, like, most of my life, I think I'm a tax resident? I mean, that's what I've heard, but I'm not totally sure.

segments.advisor_message: That's a good point to clarify! Being a tax resident means you're subject to UK tax laws. Also, could you provide your National Insurance number? It's like an identifier for taxes here.
segments.client_message: Yeah, um, I have that. It’s something like AB123456C, I think? Sorry if that's a bit jumbled, but I got it somewhere.
